definition: name or river God associated with Yellow river
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]

sentences.english: Since then no one dared to mention about "the bride of river god"any more.
sentences.chinese: 打那兒以後，誰也不敢再提給河伯娶媳婦的事了。

sentences.english: What is the use of praying to Hebo?
sentences.chinese: 去祈求河伯又有什麼用呢？

sentences.english: And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
sentences.chinese: 桑拉死了，大河邊的利河伯人掃羅接續他作王。

sentences.english: And Samlah died, and Saul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
sentences.chinese: 桑拉死了，大河邊的利河伯人掃羅接續他作王。

definition: Yu the Great (c. 21st century BC) mythical leader who tamed the floods
a water goblin in Chinese mythology usually depicted as a monkey
(archaic) the four rivers (Yangtze 長江|长江[Chang2 Jiang1], Yellow 黃河|黄河[Huang2 He2], Huai 淮河[Huai2 He2], Ji 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3])/(TCM) acupuncture point SJ-9
Xi Menbao (active around 422 BC), statesman, general and hydraulic engineer of Wei state 魏國|魏国[Wei4 guo2]
Chi You, legendary creator of metalworking and weapons/comet
the Dragon King of the Eastern Sea (mythology)
Xi Wangmu, Queen Mother of the West, keeper of the peaches of immortality/popularly known as 王母娘娘
another name for 西王母[Xi1 wang2 mu3], Queen Mother of the West
